title: Why Do Airlines Still Struggle with Order Management?
excerpt: E-commerce mastered order management years ago. Why are airlines still catching up? Ann Cederhall explores the gap and the path forward.
author: Retailaer
content:
From our reading list: Ann Cederhall asks the question we've been asking for years: why do airlines still struggle with something e-commerce solved long ago? Her pragmatic, real-world perspective cuts through the theoretical frameworks to show what actually works.

The Core Question

"Why do airlines still struggle with order management when eCommerce mastered it years ago?"

The Problem

  • Legacy PNR systems and outdated protocols hinder adoption
  • Growing divide between traditional airline processes and digital retailing capabilities
  • NDC alone doesn't constitute true personalization or retailing capability

What Modern OMS Enables

An OMS "syncs up inventory, customer accounts, and logistics in real time" without holding inventory itself. Modern retailing requires:

  • Business rules engines
  • Orchestration capabilities
  • Integration flexibility
  • Data capabilities

The Path Forward

Order-based PSS provides a modernization foundation, and solutions like Retailaer's OMS demonstrate what's possible atop existing systems. The industry consensus: airlines must adopt e-commerce thinking while acknowledging industry-specific challenges.
